intro: Leiothrix retrorsa, commonly known as the backward-pointing leiothrix, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
